verses.verse: {A Call to Repentance} d {This v. is 14:2 in MT, and so throughout the chapter.} "Return, Israel, to the Lord your God, for you have fallen due to your own iniquity.

Bring a prepared speech with you as you return to the Lord . Say to him: Â«Take away all our {The Heb. lacks our} iniquity, and accept what is good. Then we will present the fruit {So LXX and DSS. MT reads bulls} of our lips.
Assyria won't save us; we won't be riding on horses, Nor will we be saying anymore to the work of our hands, "You are {The Heb. lacks You are} our God." Indeed, in you the orphan finds mercy.'
"I will correct their apostasy, loving them freely, since my anger will have turned away from them. {Lit. him}
I will be like the dew to Israel; Israel {Lit. he} will blossom like a lily, growing roots like the cedars of {The Heb. lacks the cedars of} Lebanon.
Israel's {Lit. His} branches will spread out, and its beauty will be like an olive tree, with its scent like that of Lebanon.
Those who live under its protection {Lit. shadow} will surely return. Their grain will flourish; they will blossom like a vine, and Israel's {Lit. His} scent will be like wine from Lebanon.
"Ephraim, what have I in common with idols? I have listened and will pay attention to him. I am like a flourishing cypress; in me will your fruit be found."

{Concluding Counsel} d Whoever is wise, let him understand these things. Whoever is discerning, let him know them. For the ways of the Lord are right: the righteous follow his example, but the rebellious stumble in them.
